climbs.name: Skull Cracker
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Nathan Fitzhugh, May 2003

content.description: Climb the splitter over the bulge. I believe this is the crux. Once over the bulge continue along the crack using positive face holds.
content.protection:
Gear to 3"

Bolted anchors on top of the dome.
content.location: Descent: walk off to climber's right

content.description: This is a fun and challenging hand crack, one of the better trad lines in the Pinnacles.  To the right of Mule Kick, there is an alcove with a divergent crack system.  Start up for about 10 feet, then follow the left-slanting crack.  Approaching the roof of Mule Kick, transition into the right-slanting crack and follow this to the top.  Use the bolted anchor for Mule Kick.
content.protection: gear to 3", bolted anchor shared with Mule Kick

content.description:
This enjoyable route climbs the center of Moonshine Dome's south face and goes at a surprisingly moderate grade.

Easy climbing up broken rock (optional gear to 2.5") leads to the first of three bolts which power over a small roof on huge jugs. Higher, easy slab climbing past a possible gear placement (0.04") gains the top and anchors.

Easily done as a sport route with only quickdraws, but if climbing at the grade the additional gear might be nice.

climbs.name: Cool Water
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Nathan Fitzhugh, May 2003

content.description: Start 20 ft. right of Skull Cracker. Traverse left under the large roof to the wide crack above.
